<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 904, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[744, 325, 904, 341]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 371]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 855, 621]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 219, 665]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 730, 698]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 130.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 362, 378, 381]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a prism.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 377, 806, 397]]<|/det|>
The cross-section of the prism is a trapezium with \(CD\) parallel to \(AB\) and \(AC = BD\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 409, 655, 428]]<|/det|>
\(AB = 10 \text{cm}, CD = 4 \text{cm}\) and the height of the trapezium is \(5 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 424, 440, 443]]<|/det|>
The volume of the prism is \(525 \text{cm}^3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 456, 180, 475]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 456, 403, 475]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 473, 450, 494]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 505, 445, 524]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 521, 443, 540]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 880, 109]]<|/det|>
Amir buys 3 cakes that cost \(c\) cents each and 2 loaves of bread that cost \((2c - 11)\) cents each. He spends a total of \(\$ 5.87\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 311, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[609, 305, 923, 325]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 337, 146, 355]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 337, 366, 355]]<|/det|>
A bottle of water costs \(\$ w\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 352, 405, 371]]<|/det|>
A bottle of juice costs \(\$ (w + 1)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 382, 655, 401]]<|/det|>
Alex spends \(\$ 22\) on bottles of water and \(\$ 42\) on bottles of juice.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 396, 722, 416]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 314, 447]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[604, 707, 923, 727]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 210, 670, 228]]<|/det|>
